name: Extract Purchase Orders from Gmail using Gemini AI and Save to Google Sheets
description:
# üöÄ AI-Powered Email to Purchase Order Workflow  

Automatically scan your inbox for new purchase order requests, extract order details using **Gemini AI**, and log them into **Google Sheets** ‚Äî all without manual effort.  

---

## ‚ú® Core Capabilities  
- ‚è± Runs every minute to check **unread emails**  
- üìß Filters emails by **subject**  
- ü§ñ Uses **Gemini AI** to summarize email content & extract structured order details  
- üìÖ Formats dates into **ISO calendar weeks**  
- üìä Adds product data from **Google Sheets** to complete order info  
- ‚úÖ Appends final purchase order records into a Google Sheet (without replacing previous ones)  

---

## üõ† Setup Essentials  
- üì© **Gmail account** for fetching unread emails  
- üîë **Google Gemini (PaLM) API credentials**  
- üìí **Google Sheet** with predefined purchase order headers  

---

## üìñ Activation Guide  
1. ‚öôÔ∏è Configure **Gmail & Google Sheets** credentials in n8n  
2. üéØ Adjust the **subject filter** to match your email rules  
3. üîå Connect **Gemini AI** with your API credentials  
4. üìë Create a **Google Sheet** with the required headers  
5. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Activate the workflow and let it run in the background  

---

## üé® Customizing the Workflow  
- üîç **Email Filters** ‚Üí Change keywords in the filter node to match your purchase order email subjects  
- üè∑ **Order Fields** ‚Üí Modify **Set** and **Append to Google Sheet** nodes if your schema differs  
- ‚úçÔ∏è **AI Instructions** ‚Üí Adjust the AI Agent‚Äôs prompt to fit your company‚Äôs email style or product details  
- ‚è≤ **Frequency** ‚Üí Update the **Cron node** if you want to scan emails less often  
- üìÇ **Target Google Sheet** ‚Üí Point to a different sheet or tab depending on your department or customer  

---

workflow.name: Email scanning and purchase order creation in Google Sheet

parameters.text:
=# Role  
You are an Expert AI Agent specialized in reading emails, extracting purchase order details, enriching them with product information using the Google Sheet tool, and normalizing dates into calendar weeks (Kalenderwoche).  

# Task  
- Input: {{ $('If').item.json.text }}  
- Context: The email may contain purchase order details either in:  
  - A formatted table, or  
  - A freeform paragraph.  
- Language: The email text can be in any language. You must understand and process it.  

# Instructions  
1. Read the email text carefully.  
2. Identify purchase order details, including:  
   - Product/package name  
   - Quantity / number of items  
   - Any other order-related details (sizes, variants, etc. if available).  
3. Detect **dates or time expressions** that refer to delivery, booking, or campaign execution.  
   - If the text contains a direct week reference (e.g., *KW36*), use it directly.  
   - If the text contains a month or vague time reference (e.g., *end of October*), convert it into the appropriate calendar week(s).  
     - *‚ÄúStart of X month‚Äù* ‚Üí first calendar week of that month.  
     - *‚ÄúMid of X month‚Äù* ‚Üí middle calendar week of that month.  
     - *‚ÄúEnd of X month‚Äù* ‚Üí last calendar week of that month.  
   - Use ISO week numbering (Monday as first day of the week).  
4. Populate both `Kalenderwoche Start` and `Kalenderwoche Ende`.  
   - If only one week is identified, set both Start and End to the same week.  
   - If a date range is mentioned, map Start and End accordingly.  
5. Query the **Google Sheet tool** to fetch full product details (e.g., product code, price, description, stock availability).  
6. Merge the extracted order information with the Google Sheet product details.  
7. **Return only the final `items` array as JSON. Do not include order_id, customer, or notes.**  
8. Ensure all keys are translated into the email‚Äôs language or standardized consistently.  

# Output Format  
Return **only this JSON array**:  
```json
[
  { "Laufende Nummer":"<string>",
    "Lieferant":"<string>",
    "Lieferanten-Nr": "<number or null>",
    "Marke": "<string or null>",
    "Marken-Nr": "<number or null>",
    "Kalenderwoche Start": "<string, e.g., KW36>",
    "Kalenderwoche Ende": "<string, e.g., KW36>",
    "Marketing Status": "<string or null>",
    "Paket": "<string>",
    "Produkt": "<string>",
    "L√§nder-Aktivierung": "<string or null>",
    "Kosten": "<number or null>",
    "quantity": "<number>"
  }
]

nodes.name: Get row(s) in sheet in Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## Scan Email on every minute and read new emails.
**Get new emails frequently and filer them which has purchase order**

## Check the document has attachment
**Check for email without attachment. To read purchase order from the email body**

nodes.name: Reformatted to upload in Google sheet

parameters.content: ## AI Agent to read and summarize the order.
## Append purchase order to Google sheet

## üìß Email Reading & Purchase Order Creation (AI-powered)

**‚ú® What it does**  
- ‚è± Reads unread emails every minute  
- üéØ Filters emails based on **Subject**  
- ü§ñ Uses Gemini AI to summarize emails & extract purchase order details  
- üìä Appends purchase order data to Google Sheets  

**üõ† Requirements**  
- üì© Gmail account access to fetch unread emails  
- üîë Gemini AI credentials for summarization & extraction  
- üìë Google Sheet with predefined purchase order headers  

**‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions**  
1. üîó Set up Google Sheets & Gmail credentials in n8n  
2. üìù Configure the filter node with your subject rules  
3. ü§ù Connect Gemini AI with the correct credentials  
4. üìÇ Create & configure a Google Sheet with the necessary purchase order headers

main.node: Reformatted to upload in Google sheet

user.name: Sayone Technologies
user.bio: SayOne Technologies is a digital transformation and IT services company headquartered in India, with a strong focus on web, mobile, and AI-driven solutions for the retail tech space. With over a decade of experience, SayOne partners with global businesses to build scalable applications, optimize inventory and operations using next-gen AI, and deliver customer-centric digital products.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
